block.p: The Intel Corporation said it had reorganized its business groups in response to changes in the microcomputer market. The computer chips maker said it would now have five product groups and three staff operations on the group level, compared with three product groups and two staff groups previously. The changes were motivated more by a need for greater organizational efficiencies than by cost-cutting concerns, a spokesman said. No layoffs are expected as a result.
